Key Arguments: The bill poses a grave threat to free speech.
The government and large media bodies would have undue power to decide what information is correct, leading to bias and injustice.
Censorship of public debate is inappropriate and dangerous.
The bill would prevent Australians from presenting views that the government disagrees with.
Free speech is essential for societal development and the evolution of laws.
History shows that government views on misinformation can change, highlighting the need for free speech.
Notable Quotes: I consider this bill to be egregious in nature and a grave threat to free speech.
It is not appropriate for the government to censor public debate.
History has clearly shown that government does not always maintain the same viewpoint regarding misinformation.
